x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Colleges and universities struggle to efficiently manage campus recruitment drives. Placement officers use spreadsheets and emails to coordinate with companies, resulting in missed communication, poor tracking, and low visibility of student readiness. Students also lack a transparent view of available drives and their application status.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.project_name: “CampusDrivesConnect” — Streamlined Campus Placement and Drive Management Platform
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

A ServiceNow app for managing the entire campus recruitment lifecycle:

Companies can post job drives through a Service Portal.

Eligible students automatically receive notifications and can apply online.

Flow Designer routes applications to placement officers for review.

Dashboards display placement statistics, offers by department, and eligibility analytics.

Virtual Agent can answer FAQs like “Am I eligible for this drive?” or “What’s my application status?”.

 

App Engine Studio — to build core modules for drives, applications, and eligibility tracking

Flow Designer — for automation of approval and notifications

Service Portal — for student and recruiter interaction

Reporting & Dashboards — for placement metrics and insights

Virtual Agent — for student support and quick queries

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

Integration with LinkedIn or college ERP systems to import student details

Optional integration with email/SMS gateways for notifications

Document upload APIs for resumes and offer letters

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Ensuring accurate eligibility matching (e.g., CGPA, branch, or skill-based criteria)

Data security for student profiles and offer letters

Change management to train TPOs and recruiters to use the new system
